awd_titl_txt: Collaborative Research: Three-Dimensinal Deformation of     Subducting Slabs: Observations and Kinematic Modeling
awd_abstract_narration: This research deals with the problem of how slabs deform as                   they descend into the mantle, and how this deformation is related               to the observed seismicity.  This problem is very difficult to                  formulate and this research adopts a variational principle, a                   minimum strain energy approach, as a starting point.  Seismicity                will be studied by analysis of existing catalogues and finite                   thickness slab models will be used to analyze the strain.                       Previous work done in the Aleutians and Cascadia will be compared               to this study which will concentrate on western Pacific and South               American subduction zones.  This research relates slab distortion               to seismicity at subduction zones and is a component of the                     National Earthquake Hazard Reduction Program.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: TRUSTEES OF THE COLORADO SCHOOL OF MINES
